info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 02 at 6:32PM EDT until June 02 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL CHESTERFIELD...WEST CENTRAL CHARLES CITY...NORTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGE...HENRICO...SOUTHEASTERN HANOVER AND WEST CENTRAL KING WILLIAM COUNTIES...THE CITY OF RICHMOND...THE CITY OF COLONIAL HEIGHTS AND THE CITY OF HOPEWELL... At 632 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Richmond, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... East Highland Park around 635 PM EDT. Highland Springs around 640 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Enfield, Richmond Heights, Birchett Estate, Jordan Point Country Club, Montrose, Sandston, Glendale, Pocahontas State Park, Richmond International and Fair Oaks. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
